content.description: Start matched on the low huge ledge. Follow good holds up to the tricky, semi heady top out. (Find the good crimp in the way back).

This was not previously listed on MP but is a very high quality line that likely has been climbed before, any beta of FA would be appreciated. If you are in the V4 range and at Cascades this should be on your short list.SDS on R hand under cling and L hand pocket/sidepull directly under Top Ramen. Make a move up to the Ramen Ledge then move Left up an angling Rail using various gastons, pinches and edges. None of the holds are huge, but with the right movement they work well. Snag the Left arete and top out by reaching back to a huge Left hand jug.
content.protection: A few pads, pretty uneven landing and some potential to swing into boulder to the left, keep it under control!

content.description: To the far right of the trail-facing boulder face, on the right side of the big close tree, match start on the massive crack. follow up through good holds to the fun top.
Fun, pretty tall, tricky top out on "Top Ramen" (V2). The hands are good and the landing isnt too shabby.
